data.text: #WindyFire (Sequoia NF, Tulare Co) - New evacuation orders issued about 20 minutes ago for this fire. Temporary evacuation point is @ Porterville College, 100 E College Ave. The evacuation map is located @  https://t.co/ow7mBqkUhH https://t.co/Sb6CmvfnCh

entity.name: Cal Fire lifts Red Flag Warnings across the state of California
entity.description: According to Cal Fire, nearly 5,000 firefighters are battling 22 wildfires in California. "Seasonable weather conditions will persist across California today, as Red Flag Warnings have expired," the department announced on Wednesday. On October 27, firefighters responded to 23 new wildfires and all were contained despite Red Flag Warning conditions.

entity.name: Large fires continue to rage in New Mexico
entity.description: Strong, gusty winds that fueled The Calf Canyon/Hermits Peak fire in New Mexico are expected to pick up by Tuesday afternoon and hot, dry and windy weather will continue through Thursday, per The National Weather Service in Albuquerque. The fire started over a month ago and threatened communities east of Santa Fe. Last week, The Washington Post reported that more than 243,000 acres have already burned in New Mexico alone this year. On May 4, President Joe Biden declared the wildfires a major disaster and ordered federal aid to supplement state and local recovery efforts in affected areas.

media.alt_text:
#WindyFire EVACUATION ORDER 09/18/21
EVACUATION ORDER for the communities of Ponderosa and Quaking Aspen. The area of warning includes M107 at Dome Rock, north to HWY 190/M90 at North Road (MT21S50), east to Route 21S05, at Needles Trail, south to Lloyd Meadow at Lower Peppermint Road (MT22S82).

A road closure is in effect for M107 from HWY 190/M90 to M50 at Parker Pass. There will be a roadblock at HWY 190 and Redwood â€“ only residents of Cedar Slope will be allowed through with proof of residency.

The temporary evacuation point where you may find information and assistance with sheltering, is at Porterville College, 100 E. College Ave. Individuals who may need assistance evacuating may call 2-1-1.
Please refer to https://tularecounty.ca.gov/emergencies/ for the Windy Fire Evacuation Warning Area Map. Call 2-1-1 for more information. Log on to https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/7841/ for incident information.
